explanation: Forces IPv6 TCP exfiltration over a secondary VPN/tunnel interface (utun4) to a link-local address on a high port, using an alternate medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Retrieve the utun4 IPv6 address with ipconfig to bind the source.
Send the data using TCP to a scoped link-local destination.
Use a non-standard port to reduce detection while keeping to the alternate medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command uses valid nc flags (-6, -s), balanced quoting and command substitution, a correctly formatted IPv6 link-local address with zone index, and proper input redirection.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly exfiltrates the file over IPv6 bound to utun4 to a link‑local peer as described, but the cited ATT&CK description (System Script Proxy Execution) does not match this netcat-based exfiltration and success depends on utun4 having an IPv6 address and a reachable link-local target.
